author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
A partially decomposed carcass of a female leopard was found inside the Anamalai Tiger Reserve by a team of officials led by Tirupur District Forest Officer A. Periasamy, during regular patrols on Sunday.

Autopsy of the animal was conducted by N. S. Manoharan, the Wildlife Veterinary Officer.

Mr. Periasamy and Dr. Manoharan told The Hindu that the leopard, aged around five years, looked to have been killed in a fight with another ‘stronger predator’.

“The brain has suffered damage,” said Mr. Periasamy. According to him the teeth of the ‘stronger predator’ must have punctured the skull of the leopard. During the post-mortem, its stomach was filled with undigested bone, quills and hair of porcupine, indicating that it had eaten its prey before the fatal encounter. Dr. Manoharan said the body samples of the leopard would be sent to laboratories.
title: Carcass of female leopard found
